intro: Lagotis macrosiphon, commonly known as the broad-siphon bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Lagotis macrosiphon plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
